sen.j: 日本 > 近畿地方 > 京都府 > 船井郡
sen.e: Japan/Kinki Region/Kyoto Prefecture/Funai-gun

sen.j: 船井郡（ふないぐん）は、京都府の中央に位置する郡。
sen.e: Funai-gun is a district (or 'gun' in Japanese) located in the center of Kyoto Prefecture.
Funai-gun is a district (or 'gun' in Japanese) located in the center of Kyoto Prefecture.
Funai-gun is a district (or 'gun' in Japanese) located in the center of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治維新まで丹波国に含まれていた。
sen.e: Funai-gun belonged to Tanba Province before the Meiji Restoration.
Funai-gun belonged to Tanba Province before the Meiji Restoration.
Funai-gun belonged to Tanba Province before the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 以下の1町を含む。
sen.e: The district includes the following town:
The district includes the following towns:

sen.j: 京丹波町（きょうたんばちょう）
sen.e: Kyotanba-cho

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1889年4月1日 - 町村制施行に伴い、船井郡に園部町と23の村が成立する。
sen.e: On April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Sonobe-cho and twenty-three villages were established in Soraku-gun.
On April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Sonobe-cho and twenty-three villages were established in Soraku-gun.
April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Sonobe-cho and twenty-three villages were established in Funai-gun.
sen.cmt: 船井郡 に修正しました。"On April "→"April "に変更しました。

sen.e: Funai-gun was comprised of one town and twenty-three villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of one town and twenty-three villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of one town and twenty-three villages.

sen.j: 1894年10月10日 - 富庄村・本荘村が合併し、富本村が発足。
sen.e: On October 10, 1894: Tominosho-mura and Honjo-mura were merged to form Tomimoto-mura.
On October 10, 1894: Tominosho-mura and Honjo-mura were merged to form Tomimoto-mura.
October 10, 1894: Tominosho-mura and Honjo-mura were merged to form Tomimoto-mura.
Funai-gun was comprised of one town and twenty-two villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of one town and twenty-two villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of one town and twenty-two villages.

sen.j: 1901年7月19日 - 須知村が町制施行し須知町となる。
sen.e: On July 19, 1901: Through the implementation of the chosei (grant of township), Shuchi-mura became Shuchi-cho.
On July 19, 1901: Through the implementation of the chosei (grant of township), Shuchi-mura became Shuchi-cho.
July 19, 1901: Through the implementation of the chosei (grant of township), Shuchi-mura became Shuchi-cho.
Funai-gun was comprised of two towns and twenty-one villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of two towns and twenty-one villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of two towns and twenty-one villages.

sen.j: 1915年1月1日 - 八木村が町制施行し八木町となる。
sen.e: On January 1, 1915: Through the implementation of the chosei, Yagi-mura became Yagi-cho.
On January 1, 1915: Through the implementation of the chosei, Yagi-mura became Yagi-cho.
January 1, 1915: Through the implementation of the chosei, Yagi-mura became Yagi-cho.
Funai-gun was comprised of three towns and twenty villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of three towns and twenty villages.
Funai-gun was comprised of three towns and twenty villages.

sen.j: 1929年4月1日 - 園部町・園部村・桐ノ庄村が合併し、園部町が発足。
sen.e: On April 1, 1929: Sonobe-cho, Sonobe-mura and Kirinosho-mura were merged to form Sonobe-cho.
On April 1, 1929: Sonobe-cho, Sonobe-mura and Kirinosho-mura were merged to form Sonobe-cho.
April 1, 1929: Sonobe-cho, Sonobe-mura and Kirinosho-mura were merged to form Sonobe-cho.
Funai-gun was comprised of three towns and eighteen villages.

On April 1, 1951: Funai-gun was comprised of three towns and ten villages.
On April 1, 1951: Funai-gun was comprised of three towns and ten villages.
April 1, 1951: Funai-gun was comprised of three towns and ten villages.

sen.j: 川辺村が園部町に編入。
sen.e: Sonobe-cho absorbed Kawabe-mura.
Sonobe-cho absorbed Kawabe-mura.
Sonobe-cho absorbed Kawabe-mura.

sen.j: 吉富村・富本村・新庄村が八木町に編入。
sen.e: Yagi-cho absorbed Yoshitomi-mura, Tomimoto-mura and Shinjo-mura.
Yagi-cho absorbed Yoshitomi-mura, Tomimoto-mura and Shinjo-mura.
Yagi-cho absorbed Yoshitomi-mura, Tomimoto-mura and Shinjo-mura.

sen.j: 竹野村が須知町に編入。
sen.e: Shuchi-cho absorbed Takeno-mura.
Shuchi-cho absorbed Takeno-mura.
Shuchi-cho absorbed Takeno-mura.

sen.j: 檜山村・梅田村・三ノ宮村・質美村が合併し、瑞穂村が発足。
sen.e: Hinokiyama-mura, Umeda-mura, Sannomiya-mura and Shitsumi-mura were merged to form Mizuho-mura.
Hinokiyama-mura, Umeda-mura, Sannomiya-mura and Shitsumi-mura were merged to form Mizuho-mura.
Hinokiyama-mura, Umeda-mura, Sannomiya-mura and Shitsumi-mura were merged to form Mizuho-mura.
On April 1, 1955: Funai-gun was comprised of six towns and three villages.

sen.j: 瑞穂村が町制施行し瑞穂町 (京都府)が発足。
sen.e: Through the implementation of the chosei, Mizuho-mura became Mizuho-cho.
Through the implementation of the chosei, Mizuho-mura became Mizuho-cho.
Through the implementation of the chosei, Mizuho-mura became Mizuho-cho (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: 須知町・高原村が合併し、丹波町が発足。
sen.e: Shuchi-cho and Takahara-mura were merged to form Tanba-cho.
Shuchi-cho and Takahara-mura were merged to form Tanba-cho.
Shuchi-cho and Takahara-mura were merged to form Tanba-cho.

sen.j: 世木村・五ヶ荘村・胡麻郷村が合併し、日吉町 (京都府)が発足。
sen.e: Seki-mura, Gokasho-mura and Gomago-mura were merged to form Hiyoshi-cho (Kyoto Prefecture).
Seki-mura, Gokasho-mura and Gomago-mura were merged to form Hiyoshi-cho (Kyoto Prefecture).
Seki-mura, Gokasho-mura and Gomago-mura were merged to form Hiyoshi-cho (Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 上和知村・下和知村が合併し、和知町が発足。
sen.e: Kamiwachi-mura and Shimowachi-mura were merged to form Wachi-cho.
Kamiwachi-mura and Shimowachi-mura were merged to form Wachi-cho.
Kamiwachi-mura and Shimowachi-mura were merged to form Wachi-cho.

sen.j: 北桑田郡神吉村が八木町に編入。
sen.e: Yagi-cho absorbed Kamiyoshi-mura, Kita-Kuwada-gun.
Yagi-cho absorbed Kamiyoshi-mura, Kita-Kuwada-gun.
Yagi-cho absorbed Kamiyoshi-mura, Kita-Kuwada-gun.

sen.j: 1955年4月20日 - 園部町・摩気村・西本梅村が合併し、園部町が発足。
sen.e: On April 20, 1955: Sonobe-cho, Make-mura and Nishihonme-mura were merged to form Sonobe-cho.
On April 20, 1955: Sonobe-cho, Make-mura and Nishihonme-mura were merged to form Sonobe-cho.

sen.j: 1956年9月30日 - 東本梅村が亀岡市に編入。
sen.e: On September 30, 1956: Kameoka City absorbed Higasihonme-mura.
On September 30, 1956: Kameoka City absorbed Higasihonme-mura.

sen.j: 1958年4月1日 - 園部町が亀岡市の一部を編入。
sen.e: On April 1, 1958: Sonobe-cho absorbed a part of Kameoka City.
On April 1, 1958: Sonobe-cho absorbed a part of Kameoka City.

sen.j: 2005年10月11日 - 丹波町・和知町・瑞穂町が合併し、京丹波町が発足。
sen.e: On October 11, 2005: Tanba-cho, Wachi-cho and Mizuho-cho were merged to form Kyotanba-cho.
On October 11, 2005: Tanba-cho, Wachi-cho and Mizuho-cho were merged to form Kyotanba-cho.
October 11, 2005: Tanba-cho, Wachi-cho and Mizuho-cho were merged to form Kyotanba-cho.
Funai-gun was comprised of four towns.

sen.j: 2006年1月1日 - 園部町・八木町・日吉町が北桑田郡美山町 (京都府)と合併し、南丹市が発足、郡より離脱。
sen.e: On January 1, 2006: Sonobe-cho, Yagi-cho and Hiyoshi-cho were merged with Miyama-cho, Kita-Kuwada-gun to form Nantan City, and the city was separated from the gun (district) system.
On January 1, 2006: Sonobe-cho, Yagi-cho and Hiyoshi-cho were merged with Miyama-cho, Kita-Kuwada-gun to form Nantan City, and the city was separated from the gun (district) system.
January 1, 2006: Sonobe-cho, Yagi-cho and Hiyoshi-cho were merged with Miyama-cho, Kita-Kuwada-gun (Kyoto Prefecture) to form Nantan City, and the city was separated from the gun (district) system.
sen.cmt: 京都府 追加しました。"On January"→"January"に変更しました。
